function.name: complex
function.short: Construct a complex multivector from real multivectors.

long.para: complex takes two multivector arguments and constructs a complexified multivector with the first multivector as real part, and the second as the imaginary part. The result is equivalent to a + i * b (where i is the standard &matlab; complex operator).

Once constructed, a complexified multivector can be separated into complex parts or grades or into two multivectors (real and imaginary). It is of course also possible to construct complexified multivectors by other means, using the constructor function supplied with complex arguments.
